headline: Young leads surging Hawks past struggling Cavaliers
author: CHARLES ODUM - AP Sports Writer
sentences: ATLANTA (AP) – Trae Young scored 30 points and the surging Atlanta Hawks never trailed while beating the short-handed Cleveland Cavaliers 131-107 to clinch a spot in the Eastern Conference play-in tournament.
Cavaliers standout rookie Evan Mobley missed his second consecutive game with an ankle sprain.
Young had nine assists as the Hawks’ fourth consecutive win clinched no worse than the No.
10 spot in the Eastern Conference and a berth in the play-in tournament.
Cleveland has lost two straight and five of six.
Darius Garland had 18 points and eight assists.
Cedi Osman led Cleveland with 21 points.
